CatDescriptText: Mr. John V. van Holt, employment agency assistant director, Penn Hills and Mr. Steve Beaver, truck driver, South Side, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 31, 1962, pg. A3 with question: "Should relief payments to unemployed persons be increased?" Mr. van Holt's answer reads: "Definitely.  The cost of living has increased to such an extent that it's difficult for these people to make ends meet on the payments they're getting."  Mr. Beaver's answer reads: "Yes.  Today they can not live on what they are getting."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of John V. van Holt wearing eyeglasses and pinstriped suit jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Steve Beaver wearing zippered jacket, eyeglasses, and hat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
